person:biography.personal-details:content: Walid M.A. Ahmed is an associate professor of Business Administration at Ahmed Bin Mohammad Military College, Doha, Qatar. He teaches in both the MBA program and various undergraduate programs. His MBA courses include the first year required course in Financial Management. At the undergraduate level, he teaches a number of disciplines related to finance, such as corporate finance, financial markets and institutions, and investments. He earned his BS degree in Business Administration from Ain Shams University, Egypt in 1991 and an MBA degree from the same university in 1999. Through a channel system between Glasgow Caledonian University, the UK and Ain Shams University, Egypt, he received his Doctorate degree in 2008. His research interests include the relationship between financial markets and the economy, financial regulation, empirical asset pricing and portfolio management. Dr. Walid published several articles in Research in International Business and Finance, Review of Accounting and Finance, Applied Financial Economics, International Journal of Emerging Markets, and International Journal of Business and Emerging Markets.
